content.title: Funding | UCLA Graduate Programs
content.description: Fund your grad studies with fellowships, grants, research and TA-ships. Home of the GRAPES financial aid database and other tools to finance graduate...

            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="record-container">
                <h1 _ngcontent-c2="">Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship</h1>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">The Hosei International Fund (HIF) offers 2-3 fellowships for up to 1 year to PhD scholars who will do non-degree research at Hosei University in Tokyo.

The HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship Program is a program where are young scholars from abroad who are enrolled in a doctoral degree program or hold an equivalent degree are provided an opportunity to carry out non-degree research programs at Hosei University under the direction of and/or in cooperation with Hosei University faculty and researchers. Calls for application are made and scholarships are offered to young scholars from abroad who can be expected to contribute research results and to the development of the university's research capabilities through cooperative research with Hosei University faculty.</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="Eligibility">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Eligibility & Requirements</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Applicants must be a foreign national (includes stateless person, foreign national currently residing in Japan).
Must be presently enrolled in a doctoral degree program, hold a doctorate, or its equivalent.
Research areas include those studies in the humanities, social or natural sciences, or engineering as deemed acceptable by Hosei.
Must be fluent in either Japanese or English.
Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st.
Research description and plan.
2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career.
1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research.
Degree certificate.
Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with.
Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language).
Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts.
Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable.
App</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="Academic">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Academic Level</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Current Graduate Student. Working on Doctoral Dissertation. Postdoctoral Scholar. </p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="disciplines">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Disciplines</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Engineering. Humanities. Life Sciences. Physical Sciences. Social Sciences. Management. Law. </p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="agency">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Agency</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Hosei International Fund (HIF)<br _ngcontent-c2="">Hosei University</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="needhelp">

We are ready to assist you with one-on-one appointments, workshops, and more.<br _ngcontent-c2=""><br _ngcontent-c2=""></p>
            </div>

// When the user clicks the button, open the modal 
btn.onclick = function() {
  modal.style.display = "block";
}

// When the user clicks on <span> (x), close the modal
span.onclick = function() {
  modal.style.display = "none";
}

// When the user clicks anywhere outside of the modal, close it
window.onclick = function(event) {
  if (event.target == modal) {
    modal.style.display = "none";
  }
}
</script>

Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship

The Hosei International Fund (HIF) offers 2-3 fellowships for up to 1 year to PhD scholars who will do non-degree research at Hosei University in Tokyo. The HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship Program is a program where are young scholars from abroad who are enrolled in a doctoral degree program or hold an equivalent degree are provided an opportunity to carry out non-degree research programs at Hosei University under the direction of and/or in cooperation with Hosei University faculty and researchers. Calls for application are made and scholarships are offered to young scholars from abroad who can be expected to contribute research results and to the development of the university's research capabilities through cooperative research with Hosei University faculty.

Eligibility & Requirements

Applicants must be a foreign national (includes stateless person, foreign national currently residing in Japan). Must be presently enrolled in a doctoral degree program, hold a doctorate, or its equivalent. Research areas include those studies in the humanities, social or natural sciences, or engineering as deemed acceptable by Hosei. Must be fluent in either Japanese or English. Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st. Research description and plan. 2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career. 1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research. Degree certificate. Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with. Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language). Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts. Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable. App

Academic Level

Current Graduate Student. Working on Doctoral Dissertation. Postdoctoral Scholar.

Disciplines

Engineering. Humanities. Life Sciences. Physical Sciences. Social Sciences. Management. Law.

Agency

Hosei International Fund (HIF)Hosei University

Need help applying?

Visit our list of resources for finding & applying for fellowships. We are ready to assist you with one-on-one appointments, workshops, and more.

Last Updated :: 10/28/2024

Fellowship Details
Deadline:

06-01-2026
Amount: $36,000
Stipend: Monthly stipend of 300,000 yen plus round trip travel subsidy and shared office space.
Citizenship: No citizenship requirements.
Award Type: Fellowship/Grant
Phone: +81-3-3264-4624
Email: hif@hosei.ac.jp
Address

Coordinator, HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship International Center, Hosei University 2-17-1 Fujimi, Chiyoda-ku Tokyo, 102-8160 Japan

            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="record-container">
                <h1 _ngcontent-c2="">Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship</h1>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">The Hosei International Fund (HIF) offers 2-3 fellowships for up to 1 year to PhD scholars who will do non-degree research at Hosei University in Tokyo.

The HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship Program is a program where are young scholars from abroad who are enrolled in a doctoral degree program or hold an equivalent degree are provided an opportunity to carry out non-degree research programs at Hosei University under the direction of and/or in cooperation with Hosei University faculty and researchers. Calls for application are made and scholarships are offered to young scholars from abroad who can be expected to contribute research results and to the development of the university's research capabilities through cooperative research with Hosei University faculty.</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="Eligibility">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Eligibility & Requirements</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Applicants must be a foreign national (includes stateless person, foreign national currently residing in Japan).
Must be presently enrolled in a doctoral degree program, hold a doctorate, or its equivalent.
Research areas include those studies in the humanities, social or natural sciences, or engineering as deemed acceptable by Hosei.
Must be fluent in either Japanese or English.
Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st.
Research description and plan.
2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career.
1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research.
Degree certificate.
Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with.
Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language).
Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts.
Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable.
App</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="Academic">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Academic Level</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Current Graduate Student. Working on Doctoral Dissertation. Postdoctoral Scholar. </p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="disciplines">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Disciplines</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Engineering. Humanities. Life Sciences. Physical Sciences. Social Sciences. Management. Law. </p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="agency">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Agency</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Hosei International Fund (HIF)<br _ngcontent-c2="">Hosei University</p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2="" class="needhelp">
                <h3 _ngcontent-c2="">Need help applying?</h3>
                <p _ngcontent-c2="" class="pre-wrap">Visit our list of <a _ngcontent-c2="" href="https://grad.ucla.edu/funding/financial-aid/fellowship-proposal-resources/"><strong _ngcontent-c2="">resources for finding & applying for fellowships</strong></a>. We are ready to assist you with one-on-one appointments, workshops, and more.<br _ngcontent-c2=""><br _ngcontent-c2=""></p>
            </div>
            <div _ngcontent-c2=""><p _ngcontent-c2="" style="font-size: 14px;"><br _ngcontent-c2="">Last Updated :: 10/28/2024<br _ngcontent-c2="">
                <a _ngcontent-c2="" href="http://ucla2.GRAPES-Request-Form.sgizmo.com/s3/?award=Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship"><strong _ngcontent-c2="">Update this award or add a new award</strong></a></p>
            </div>

// Get the modal
var modal = document.getElementById("myModal");

// Get the button that opens the modal
var btn = document.getElementById("myBtn");

// Get the <span> element that closes the modal
var span = document.getElementsByClassName("close")[0];

// When the user clicks the button, open the modal 
btn.onclick = function() {
  modal.style.display = "block";
}

// When the user clicks on <span> (x), close the modal
span.onclick = function() {
  modal.style.display = "none";
}

// When the user clicks anywhere outside of the modal, close it
window.onclick = function(event) {
  if (event.target == modal) {
    modal.style.display = "none";
  }
}
</script>

Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship

The Hosei International Fund (HIF) offers 2-3 fellowships for up to 1 year to PhD scholars who will do non-degree research at Hosei University in Tokyo. The HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship Program is a program where are young scholars from abroad who are enrolled in a doctoral degree program or hold an equivalent degree are provided an opportunity to carry out non-degree research programs at Hosei University under the direction of and/or in cooperation with Hosei University faculty and researchers. Calls for application are made and scholarships are offered to young scholars from abroad who can be expected to contribute research results and to the development of the university's research capabilities through cooperative research with Hosei University faculty.

Eligibility & Requirements

Applicants must be a foreign national (includes stateless person, foreign national currently residing in Japan). Must be presently enrolled in a doctoral degree program, hold a doctorate, or its equivalent. Research areas include those studies in the humanities, social or natural sciences, or engineering as deemed acceptable by Hosei. Must be fluent in either Japanese or English. Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st. Research description and plan. 2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career. 1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research. Degree certificate. Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with. Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language). Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts. Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable. App

Academic Level

Current Graduate Student. Working on Doctoral Dissertation. Postdoctoral Scholar.

Disciplines

Engineering. Humanities. Life Sciences. Physical Sciences. Social Sciences. Management. Law.

Agency

Hosei International Fund (HIF)Hosei University

Need help applying?

Visit our list of resources for finding & applying for fellowships. We are ready to assist you with one-on-one appointments, workshops, and more.

Last Updated :: 10/28/2024

Fellowship Details
Deadline:

06-01-2026
Amount: $36,000
Stipend: Monthly stipend of 300,000 yen plus round trip travel subsidy and shared office space.
Citizenship: No citizenship requirements.
Award Type: Fellowship/Grant
Phone: +81-3-3264-4624
Email: hif@hosei.ac.jp
Address

Coordinator, HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship International Center, Hosei University 2-17-1 Fujimi, Chiyoda-ku Tokyo, 102-8160 Japan

Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st. Research description and plan. 2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career. 1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research. Degree certificate. Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with. Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language). Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts. Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable. App

UCLA Graduate Programs Save time searching for funding Search for Funding Financial Aid & Finances Tuition Calendar Working at UCLA FAQs Back to Search Hosei International Fund Foreign Scholars Fellowship The Hosei International Fund (HIF) offers 2-3 fellowships for up to 1 year to PhD scholars who will do non-degree research at Hosei University in Tokyo. The HIF Foreign Scholars Fellowship Program is a program where are young scholars from abroad who are enrolled in a doctoral degree program or hold an equivalent degree are provided an opportunity to carry out non-degree research programs at Hosei University under the direction of and/or in cooperation with Hosei University faculty and researchers. Calls for application are made and scholarships are offered to young scholars from abroad who can be expected to contribute research results and to the development of the university's research capabilities through cooperative research with Hosei University faculty. Eligibility & Requirements Applicants must be a foreign national (includes stateless person, foreign national currently residing in Japan). Must be presently enrolled in a doctoral degree program, hold a doctorate, or its equivalent. Research areas include those studies in the humanities, social or natural sciences, or engineering as deemed acceptable by Hosei. Must be fluent in either Japanese or English. Be no more than 39 years of age as April 1st. Research description and plan. 2 complete copies of applicant’s book, or thesis considered most significant in his/her academic career. 1 letter of recommendation from the head of the institution with which the applicant is affiliated, and 1 from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s research. Degree certificate. Certificate attesting to institution presently enrolled in or affiliated with. Certificate of applicant’s Japanese or English ability (TOEFL score etc) or a letter from the applicant’s supervisor or instructor attesting to the applicant’s Japanese or English ability if there is neither result nor score of examinations to certify the ability (this is not required for native language). Positions are not available in medical or veterinary sciences, pharmacology, nursing, agriculture, marine sciences, home economics, fine arts. Any research involving the import/export of components and/or technology which could lead to creation, production and development of weapons of mass destruction is unacceptable.
